answers.answer: Hi there!Well, without a detailed description of the symptoms or a detailed clinical evaluation it would be difficult to comment specifically on the situation. A ‘leaky gut syndrome’ is not particularly a diagnosis but rather a vague term pointing to a GI issue such as inflammation,  malsorption, GI motility issues etc. It would be best to have this evaluated in detail by a gastroenterologist for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate management.Body odour can be caused due to a number of reasons like poor hygiene, infections (fungal, bacterial or parasitic), hormonal changes during puberty, hyperhydrosis, some metabolic disorders, a few foods like spices garlic etc, stale sweat, gastrointestinal disorders, diabetes, ketoacidosis, urinary tract infection, scurvy etc. In your case if you feel the smell is strong it would be best to get evaluated by a primary care physician for a possible secondary cause so that it can be treated appropriately.Hope this helps.Take care!
